title: Windows Defender allow apps question LoL Kernel and LoL Launcher
body:
My windows 10 updated, so before playing I had to double check everything, manually remove Cortana (3rd time...she annoys me) 
and check the Firewall exceptions.

League of Legends is check-marked under private and public (as it should be) but LoL Kernel and LoL Launcher are only check-marked for Private.
I looked through the LoL support Firewall guide and can't see any mention of them so I was wondering if anyone can help me out on if "Public" _should_ or _shouldn't_ be checkmarked for those two as well.

Thanks a bunch,

-LostFr0st

replies.body: Your windows update may have reconfigured some of your security settings.  It could be blocking the patcher from launching or scanning game files, which would result in the kernel error.  Go through each step in our [permissions](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions) guide to troubleshoot and get this resolved.  Let me know if you have any questions.

So if I'm not having a problem launching or connecting to bot or ARAM games, not checking "public" for those two is fine?

I just finished my summer job so I finally have time for Ranked and was doing pre-take-off checks if you will, then Windows updated and added to my list of stuff to check.

Thanks for your time again Porocles.^^
